TaxRateModel.description:
Contains information about the general tangible personal property sales tax rates for this jurisdiction.
            
This rate is calculated by making assumptions about the tax calculation process.  It does not account for:
            
* Sourcing rules, such as origin-and-destination based transactions.
* Product taxability rules, such as different tax rates for different product types.
* Nexus declarations, where some customers are not obligated to collect tax in specific jurisdictions.
* Tax thresholds and rate differences by amounts.
* And many more custom use cases.
            
To upgrade to a fully-featured and accurate tax process that handles these scenarios correctly, please
contact Avalara to upgrade to AvaTax!

totalRate.description:
The total sales tax rate for general tangible personal property sold at a retail point of presence
in this jurisdiction on this date.

rates.description:
The list of individual rate elements for general tangible personal property sold at a retail
point of presence in this jurisdiction on this date.

RateModel.description: Indicates one element of a sales tax rate.

rate.description: The sales tax rate for general tangible personal property in this jurisdiction.

name.description: A readable name of the tax or taxing jurisdiction related to this tax rate.

type.description: The type of jurisdiction associated with this tax rate.

AdjustTransactionModel.description: Replace an existing transaction recorded in AvaTax with a new one.

adjustmentReason.description: A reason code indicating why this adjustment was made

adjustmentDescription.description:
If the AdjustmentReason is "Other", specify the reason here.
            
This is required when the AdjustmentReason is 8 (Other).

newTransaction.description: Replace the current transaction with tax data calculated for this new transaction

SettleTransactionModel.description:
Settle this transaction with your ledger by executing one or many actions against that transaction.
            
You may use this endpoint to verify the transaction, change the transaction's code, and commit the transaction for reporting purposes.
This endpoint may be used to execute any or all of these actions at once.

verify.description:
To verify this transaction, you may provide information in this field.
            
If you leave this field null, the transaction will not be verified.

changeCode.description:
To change the code for this transaction, you may provide information in this field.
            
If you leave this field null, the transaction's code will not be changed.

commit.description:
To commit this transaction so that it can be reported on a tax filing, you may provide information in this field.
            
If you leave this field null, the transaction's commit status will not be changed.
            
If you use Avalara's Managed Returns Service, committing a transaction will allow that transaction to be filed.

VerifyTransactionModel.description:
Verify this transaction by matching it to values in your accounting system.
            
You may specify one or more of the following fields to verify: `date`, `totalAmount`, or `totalTax`.
This call will report an error if there is any difference between the data stored in AvaTax and
the data stored in your accounting system.

verifyTransactionDate.description:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTransactionDate` and
the `documentDate` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
            
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

verifyTotalAmount.description:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTotalAmount` and
the `totalAmount` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
            
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

verifyTotalTax.description:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTotalTax` and
the `totalTax` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
            
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

ChangeTransactionCodeModel.description:
Settle this transaction with your ledger by verifying its amounts.
If the transaction is not yet committed, you may specify the "commit" value to commit it to the ledger and allow it to be reported.
You may also optionally change the transaction's code by specifying the "newTransactionCode" value.

newCode.description: To change the transaction code for this transaction, specify the new transaction code here.

CommitTransactionModel.description: Commit this transaction as permanent so that it can be reported on a tax filing.

commit.description:
Set this value to be `true` to commit this transaction.
            
Committing a transaction allows it to be reported on a tax filing.  Uncommitted transactions will not be reported.

isLocked.description:
Set this value to be true to commit this transaction.
Committing a transaction allows it to be reported on a tax return.  Uncommitted transactions will not be reported.
The lock status to set for the documents designated in this API

BulkLockTransactionResult.description: Returns information about transactions that were locked

numberOfRecords.description: Number of records that have been modified

adjustmentReason.description: A reason code indicating why this adjustment was made

adjustmentDescription.description:
If the AdjustmentReason is "Other", specify the reason here.
            
This is required when the AdjustmentReason is 8 (Other).

createTransactionModel.description:
The create transaction model to be created or updated.
            
If the transaction does not exist, create transaction.
If the transaction exists, adjust the existing transaction.

AuditTransactionModel.description: Information about a previously created transaction

companyId.description: Unique ID number of the company that created this transaction

serverTimestamp.description: Server timestamp, in UTC, of the date/time when the original transaction was created

serverDuration.description: Length of time the original API call took

ReconstructedApiRequestResponseModel.description:
This model contains a reconstructed CreateTransaction request object that could potentially be used
to recreate this transaction.
            
Note that the API changes over time, and this reconstructed model is likely different from the exact request
that was originally used to create this transaction.

AddTransactionLineModel.description: Model to add specific lines to exising transaction

transactionCode.description: document code for the transaction to add lines

lines.description: List of lines to be added

renumber.description: Option to renumber lines after add. After renumber, the line number becomes: "1", "2", "3", ...

RemoveTransactionLineModel.description: Model to specify lines to be removed

transactionCode.description: document code for the transaction to add lines

lines.description: List of lines to be added

renumber.description: ption to renumber lines after removal. After renumber, the line number becomes: "1", "2", "3", ...

InspectLineResponseModel.description: Response model used as output for InspectLine API.

determinationFactors.description: A list of determination factors for a line that is being inspected through the InspectLine API.

example.description: No tax was calculated because no nexus was declared in XYZ.

determinationFactors.description: No tax was calculated because no nexus was declared in XYZ.

DeterminationFactorModel.description: This object represents a single determination factor for a line that is being inspected through the InspectLine API.

description.description: Determination reason description.
description.example: No tax was calculated because no nexus was declared in XYZ.

example.description: No tax was calculated because no nexus was declared in XYZ.

permissions.description: List of API names and categories that this user is permitted to access

accessLevel.description: What access privileges does the current user have to see companies?

companies.description: The identities of all companies this user is permitted to access

authenticated.description: Returns true if you provided authentication for this API call; false if you did not.

authenticationType.description: Returns the type of authentication you provided, if authenticated

authenticatedUserName.description: The username of the currently authenticated user, if any.

authenticatedUserId.description: The ID number of the currently authenticated user, if any.

authenticatedAccountId.description: The ID number of the currently authenticated user's account, if any.

authenticatedCompanyId.description: The ID number of the currently authenticated user's company, if any.

OauthSecurity.description: A bearer token provided by the Avalara Identity server.

UserSecurity.description: Basic authentication supports either Username/Password or AccountId/LicenseKey, using Base64 encoding.
